newsitem.title: USA: Mitsubishi recalls 93,000 cars for faulty brake hoses.
newsitem.headline: Mitsubishi recalls 93,000 cars for faulty brake hoses.

text.p: Mitsubishi Motor Sales of America, Inc. said Thursday it is recalling up to 93,000 vehicles sold in the United States due to potentially faulty brake hoses.

The company said the recall covers the 1992-1994 Diamante sedans; 1993-1995 Diamante Wagons equipped with anti-lock brake systems; 1991-1994 3000GT sports car models equipped with ABS brakes; and 1992-1994 Montero sport utility vehicles.
Mitsubishi, which is the U.S. unit of Japan's Mitsubishi Motors Corp., said it was notifying the owners requesting that they bring their vehicle for repair to an Mitsubishi Motors dealer.
It said the repairs will involve replacement of the left and right front wheel-side brake hoses.
